info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 19 at 3:21PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Schenectady, northwestern Albany, northern Schoharie and southeastern Montgomery Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 321 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Richmondville, or 7 miles west of Cobleskill, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cobleskill, Duanesburg, Summit, Schoharie, Richmondville, Delanson, Central Bridge, Knox, Carlisle, Sharon, Seward, Charleston, Esperance, Duane, Zeh Corners, Beekman Corners, West Richmondville, Rockwell Corners, Warnerville and Engleville. This includes Interstate 88 between exits 20 and 23. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
